news_header: All ten people on a missing passenger plane in Alaska are believed dead after wreckage was found on sea ice.
news_original_title: Alaska: Missing plane found, all 10 on board believed dead
news_text: The US Coast Guard reported that all ten individuals aboard a missing passenger plane in Alaska are presumed dead after the wreckage was located on sea ice. Initially, three bodies were found, and the remaining seven are believed to be inside the aircraft but are inaccessible due to its condition. The plane, carrying nine passengers and a pilot, went missing while flying from Unalakleet to Nome. Bering Air lost contact with the Cessna Caravan shortly after takeoff. Rescue operations are ongoing, but weather conditions are hampering air searches.
